intro: Siparuna apicifera var. acutissima, commonly known as the sharp-pointed siparuna, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of fragrant, white flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a small, capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
